title: Best San Francisco Activities in September
seo_title: Best San Francisco Activities in September
meta_description: Summer in San Francisco is unlike most parts of the country. Warm weather days are a special treat rather than an expected occurrence.
short_description: Summer in San Francisco is unlike most parts of the country. Warm weather days are a special treat rather than an expected occurrence.
long_description:
Summer in San Francisco is unlike most parts of the country. Warm weather days are a special treat rather than an expected occurrence. However, after Labor Day San Francisco routinely has some of the best weather and as a result there are so many fun activities to enjoy.

Here are some of our favorite activities near our Nob Hill hotel:

Architecture in the City– September 1-30

Sponsored by AIA San Francisco, the largest architectural and design festival in the U.S. includes a series of architectural tours, film screenings, exhibitions, design lectures, home shows and more.

 

Ghirardelli Chocolate Festival at Ghirardelli Square, September 10-11

Discover unique chocolate desserts and delicacies from Ghirardelli and beyond at this annual chocolate celebration.

Oktoberfest By The Bay, September 23-25

Pier 48 near AT&T Park

Bringing Munich’s autumn beer festival to the Bay, Oktoberfest features non-stop singing, dancing, music, German food and beverages.

You can also view our previous blog post “Stan’s San Francisco Activity Suggestions”. You can also follow @StanfordCourtSF on Instagram and Twitter for more updates.
